Package adrenaline.network.rmi.server

Class RmiServerClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • adrenaline.network.rmi.server.RmiServerClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RmiServerInterface, java.rmi.Remote
    public class RmiServerClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements RmiServerInterface
    Class that manages communication between clients and server in RMI communication. It has a Map attribute that matches each client to the server representation of client (that is, a couple ClientCallBack-RmiPlayer) to send data to the right clients when needed. This class may be considered as some kind of router that routes data in the correct directions

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RmiServerClientHandler​(MainServer server)
      Creates a new client handler with a reference to the main server which manage data, and uploads the object on the RMI registry

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void closeConnection​(RmiClientCallbackInterface remoteClient, RmiPlayer serverClient)
      Method invoked when a disconnection of a RMI client is noticed, it sets him offline, notify the disconnection to other clients and remove the reference to the client-side object from the Map attribute
      void receiveData​(RmiClientCallbackInterface client, DataForServer data)
      Handles data coming from the client and routes them to the correct server-representation by checking on the Map attribute the right corresponding object
      void registerClient​(RmiClientCallbackInterface client)
      Overrides super method to save the client's data for being able to reach it for communication when events occur by creating a server-side representation of the client and saving in the Map attribute the couple client-server side representations of the client
      void sendDataTo​(RmiPlayer player, DataForClient data)
      Routes a pack of data to the right client-side representation of a client by finding him on the Map attribute, and sends him the pack of date

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • RmiServerClientHandler

        public RmiServerClientHandler​(MainServer server)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Creates a new client handler with a reference to the main server which manage data, and uploads the object on the RMI registry
        Parameters:
        server - is the reference of the main server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs in exporting the object

    • Method Detail

      • registerClient

        public void registerClient​(RmiClientCallbackInterface client)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Overrides super method to save the client's data for being able to reach it for communication when events occur by creating a server-side representation of the client and saving in the Map attribute the couple client-server side representations of the client
        Specified by:
        registerClient in interface RmiServerInterface
        Parameters:
        client - is the client-side representation of the client
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs in the communication on the net

      • receiveData

        public void receiveData​(RmiClientCallbackInterface client,
                        DataForServer data)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Handles data coming from the client and routes them to the correct server-representation by checking on the Map attribute the right corresponding object
        Specified by:
        receiveData in interface RmiServerInterface
        Parameters:
        client - is the client who just sent a pack of date
        data - is the pack of data coming from client
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs in the communication on the net

      • sendDataTo

        public void sendDataTo​(RmiPlayer player,
                       DataForClient data)
        Routes a pack of data to the right client-side representation of a client by finding him on the Map attribute, and sends him the pack of date
        Parameters:
        player - is the server-side representation of a client used to find the client-side representation
        data - is the pack of data to be sent

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection​(RmiClientCallbackInterface remoteClient,
                            RmiPlayer serverClient)
        Method invoked when a disconnection of a RMI client is noticed, it sets him offline, notify the disconnection to other clients and remove the reference to the client-side object from the Map attribute
        Parameters:
        remoteClient - is the client-side representation of the client who just disconnected
        serverClient - is the server side representation of the client who just disconnected
